oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: From Folk, to Hillbilly, to Country - What Next? - various interviews - Part 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpt from "From Folk, to Hillbilly, to Country - What Next?" thesis for Austin Peay college by Mary Biggs, includes interviews with Murray Nash and Doug Green.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Murray Nash talks about Tex Ritter -- Nash talks about the state of the country music industry -- Mary Biggs introduces Doug Green -- Green talks about what he does at the Hall of Fame and Country Music Foundation -- Green talks about the museum -- Biggs asks about where country music started -- Green talks about exhibits in the museum -- Biggs talks about good music and bad music -- Green talks about country music's evolution along with rural America's moral perspectives -- Green talks about in which parts of the country and world country music is most prominent -- Green talks about the hall of fame as a collection and museum -- Biggs and Green talk about the origin of country music and where it's headed (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Nash, Murray;
